meanings.definition: The front of a building, especially an imposing or decorative one.
meanings.sent1: The facades of the old castle were adorned with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The hotel's facade was painted in bright colors to attract guests.
meanings.sent3: The facades of the cardboard houses in the play looked surprisingly real.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a facade hiding the sadness within.
meanings.sent5: The facades of the skyscrapers gleamed in the sunlight, creating a stunning sight.

meanings.sent1: The magician's trick created a facade of a disappearing rabbit.
meanings.sent2: She maintained a facade of confidence despite her nervousness.
meanings.sent3: The facade of the fake mustache made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His charm was just a facade to hide his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The facade of the haunted house scared the children, even though it was all fake.
